instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3023: What is 820-3023? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.SMC_RESET: What is SMC_RESET? SMC_RESET is not a signal, it is an abbreviation for “SMC_RESET_L”, which is the signal someone is referring to when they type “SMC_RESET”  "SMC_RESET_L is a signal that resets the SMC when it is low(this is what the “_L” prefix means), and lets the SMC out of reset mode when it is high. .
definitions.U7100: What is U7100? U7100 refers to the ISL6259 or ISL9239 charging IC on Macbooks from 2013 to the present.
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .
definitions.SMC_BC_ACOK: What is SMC_BC_ACOK? This is identical to CHGR_ACOK. This will come out of the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging chip when CHGR_ACIN & CHGR_DCIN are present, and is necessary for the onewire circuit to begin working. On most Macbooks, CHGR_ACOK needs to be present in order for PP3V42_G3H to flow to the onewire circuit so that the circuitry that allows the charger to communicate with the SMC will turn on.  .
definitions.SYS_ONEWIRE: What is SYS_ONEWIRE? This is a bidirectional communication line between the system management controller(SMC) and the charger that allows the charger to communicate with the SMC. This must be working for the light to come on on the magsafe charger. .
definitions.CHGR_ACOK: What is CHGR_ACOK? This is identical to SMC_BC_ACOK. This will come out of the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging chip when CHGR_ACIN & CHGR_DCIN are present, and is necessary for the onewire circuit to begin working. On most Macbooks, CHGR_ACOK needs to be present in order for PP3V42_G3H to flow to the onewire circuit so that the circuitry that allows the charger to communicate with the SMC will turn on.  .
definitions.SMC_ADAPTER_EN: What is SMC_ADAPTER_EN? SMC_ADAPTER_EN enables the machine to work off of the power adapter when the proper power adapter is attached. Attacching an 85w Macbook Pro 15” power adapter to a 13” Macbook that requires a 60w power adapter is ok, attaching a 45w Macbook Air power adapter to a 15” macbook Pro that needs an 85w power adapter will result in SMC_ADAPTER_EN missing. .
definitions.PPVCORE_S0_CPU_REG: What is PPVCORE_S0_CPU_REG? PPVCORE_S0_CPU_REG is a single phase of CPU VCORE before it is combined into PPVCORE_S0_CPU .
definitions.R7402: What is R7402? Resistor between PPVIN_S0_CPUIMVP and CPUIMVP_TON. TON stands for TIME ON – CPUIMVP_TON configures the buck converter for the CPU based on its input power supply. If this resistor is blown, the machine will turn on but not have any image, chime, or POST, because CPU vcore will be missing. This resistor is often the first to corrode because it is along a high voltage rail and it is right on the edge of the board, check this on 2011-2012 model Macbook Pros that turn on and do not chime. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3023</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> ppbus 8.40V is ok?
threads.message:
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3023</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> ppbus 8.40V is ok?
I have this board pretty clean. No liquid damage with ppbus 8.40. Not power. Customer says this air sometimes shutdown randomly and finnaly never power again.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3023</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> ppbus 8.40V is ok?
threads.message: Fine. Check voltages on <RESISTOR>R1800</RESISTOR>/1/2/3 both sides.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3023</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> ppbus 8.40V is ok?
threads.message: All 4 resistors are between 3 and 3.3V both sides.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3023</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> ppbus 8.40V is ok?
threads.message: The usual <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL>? Check for shorts on all rails, corrosion? Green light ok? Charges battery?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3023</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> ppbus 8.40V is ok?
threads.message: Green light appear only with original 85W adapter. With no geunine no green light. Also with 85W adapter green light is faintly. I need dark room to see it. Same charger in macbook pro and all compatible green light is easy to see. That means something? Tomorrow will check S5 and battery too.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3023</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> ppbus 8.40V is ok?
threads.message: That means you have no green light. Check with known good IO board and cable first.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3023</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> ppbus 8.40V is ok?
threads.message: I have another working board with ram problem here and already interchanged IO boards and all the same.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3023</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> ppbus 8.40V is ok?
threads.message: Come on engage brains, green light issues have been discussed so many times. ACOK? <SIGNAL>SMC_RESET</SIGNAL>? Trackpad disconnected?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3023</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> ppbus 8.40V is ok?
threads.message:
No light on the charger is the first issue to solve. 

1) is <SIGNAL>CHGR_ACOK</SIGNAL> present on pin 14 of <CHIP>U7100</CHIP>? 
2) are the <SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>SYS_ONEWIRE</SIGNAL>, and <SIGNAL>SMC_BC_ACOK</SIGNAL> pins on J4700?
3) Did you try a known good DC in board and DC in cable?

99% of the time it is a bad cable between dc in board & logic board, or burned pins on the connector for <SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>SYS_ONEWIRE</SIGNAL>, and <SIGNAL>SMC_BC_ACOK</SIGNAL>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3023</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> ppbus 8.40V is ok?
threads.message:
Ok, lets start gain. I do have good green light. Before I wasnot connect flex cable well between main and io board.

<SIGNAL>SMC_ADAPTER_EN</SIGNAL> - 3.38V
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> - 3.31V
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S3_REG</SIGNAL> - 5V
<SIGNAL>PPDDR_S3_REG</SIGNAL> - 1.50V

I also have 1.5 and 1.05 power supplay. What I miss is <SIGNAL>PPVCORE_S0_CPU_REG</SIGNAL> - 0V

I checked EN - pin1 <CHIP>U7400</CHIP> and it is 2.5V. Should be 3.3V
This mean <CHIP>U7400</CHIP> is bad? Should I replace MAX15092?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3023</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> ppbus 8.40V is ok?
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3023</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> ppbus 8.40V is ok?
threads.message:
Yes, it is 90K
Area arround look ok

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3023</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> ppbus 8.40V is ok?
threads.message:
Only thing I found bad was CPUVCCIOS0_RTN from <CHIP>U7600</CHIP> to the resistor. Before repaired this corroded trace I missed PPCPUVCCIO_S0_REG
After repair this trace I have PPCPUVCCIO_S0_REG stable at 1.05V
Only thing I miss now is CPU supplay and dont understand what more could be happend. No more corrosion found in the board.
